suncertify.server
Class ServerController

java.lang.Object
  suncertify.server.ServerController
All Implemented Interfaces:
Controller, RequestServer
public final class ServerController
extends java.lang.Object
implements Controller, RequestServer

MVC controller class for URLyBird server. Standalone and network server modes are supported. If running in network server mode, the server GUI will be displayed. There is a shutdown hook to ensure that the database file is shut down gracefully. Thread safety: not thread safe.

Constructor Summary

          Create a server controller in standalone mode.

          Create a server controller in network server mode.

                                  java.util.List<Criterion> criteria,

Get the number of records that match the given criteria.

Specified by:
getMatchingRecordCount in interface RequestServer
Parameters:
client - the client requesting the search
criteria - the search criteria
onlyShowModifiableRecords - if true, non-modifiable records will not be included in the search results
Returns:
the number of matching records

getSearchResults

public java.util.List<Record> getSearchResults(ServerToClientConnection client)
Get a list of some of the search results from the previous search. This method may return only some of the matching records, so it may need to be called many times for each search.

Specified by:
getSearchResults in interface RequestServer
Parameters:
client - the client that performed the search
Returns:
a list (probably a partial list) of the search results from the last search performed by the given client

modifyRecord

public void modifyRecord(ServerToClientConnection client,
                         int recordNumber,
                         java.util.List<Field> fields)
                  throws RecordNotFoundException,
                         StaleRecordException,
                         RecordNotModifiableException
Modify the record with the given record number.

Specified by:
modifyRecord in interface RequestServer
Parameters:
client - the client requesting the modification
recordNumber - the record number of the record to modify
fields - the new values for the record
Throws:
RecordNotFoundException - if the record number does not correspond to a record that is not marked as deleted
StaleRecordException - if the record has been modified without the client's knowledge
RecordNotModifiableException - if the server does not allow the record to be modified

setDatabaseFilename

public void setDatabaseFilename(ProgressListener progressListener,
                                java.lang.String newName)
                         throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                java.text.ParseException
Change the database file to the file with the given filename.

Specified by:
setDatabaseFilename in interface RequestServer
Parameters:
progressListener - listener to be notified of the progress in reading the contents of the database file
newName - the filename of the new database file
Throws:
java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the file is not found, or if the file is not writable
java.text.ParseException - if there is a problem reading the contents of the new database file
